discourse_list.title: What is the current easiest decentralized onramp to DAI for new crypto users?

content.content: What is the DAO’s current recommended method for someone with no crypto experience/>$100 to purchase and use DAI? Is the advised strategy of the DAO to push L2 dai to these potential new users to ensure they have a low transaction fee experience? If so which decentralized L2 would the DAO recommend using? The primary reason I’m asking these questions is I’ve found when I elevator pitch people Maker it’s difficult to onboard users without going through a centralized exchange which semi defeats the purpose…

Copying the great response  @flipflopflapdelegate to keep this conversation going. I really felt this topic deserved it’s own post.     What Core Units does the DAO need next? Sustainable Ecosystem Scaling       This is my personal opinion and recommendation, but NOT FINANCIAL ADVICE, NOR the DAOs recommendation–easiest way to onboard into DAI is by using CEXs like Coinbase, FTX, Binance, Kraken, Gemini (assuming they have inventory), etc. However, there’s still a lot left to be desire when using DAI to buy a Pint   at a Sports Complex. Primarily because it can only be done by using a Debit Card like the Coinbase Debit Card that charges Fees out-the-wazoo, IMO.  As you know, there are other ways …

If a user has no crypto experience and is starting with fiat, then there are several options including exchanges, on off ramp like Moonpay, or cryptocards like WireX. Dai is available on L2 and also various mainnets like BSC and Polygon

In terms of questions regarding the exchange collaboration, there are several exchanges that the protocol worked with. For example, back when the protocol had positive DSR (which allows users to stake Dai and earn reward), several major such as OKEx actively integrated and there’s some marketing going on with Coinbase

Coinbase used to offer 2% apy for Dai. I see it’s been dropped to 0.15%. I assume this is because the DAO is no longer subsidizing the promotion? Are any plans in the works to allow users to withdraw DAI directly to L2 on coinbase?

Can’t share details but can share that we are working to have several exchanges to support deposit and withdrawal from Dai on different L2 and mainnets. Similar to how USDT and USDC are currently supported on various chains on exchanges

Great. I know coinbase is working on it but it’s great to hear DAI is being included in the plans.    google.com – 1 Sep 21    Coinbase to Use Polygon’s Ethereum Scaling Solution to Reduce Prices,... An exact date for the L2 integration has not yet been made public.

Zarevok:  Coinbase used to offer 2% apy for Dai. I see it’s been dropped to 0.15%.   Wowzers! When did that happen? That sucks. 0.15% is JP Morgan Chase styled rates, eh? I guess the SEC cracking-the-whip on CEXs is causing this to happen–not sure. It’s Bananas. Well, at least Decentralized Markets like Compound & AAVE are still offering 2%++ on DAI. You can also venture out into the wild (not Financial Advice) to search for Yield. But ya, its getting rough out there

If it is focused on the use of DAI I would think that automatically just using xDAI is already a great goal for MKR, you can do all the DEFI or whatever you can think of within the network and by default you will have to use DAI in all cases.

If I think you are right about the latter, it is probably very easy to buy cryptos centrally. For example, to use a blockchain, you must have the currency of that blockchain pass it to a wallet and all that is many additional steps. @Saludiego_201 you are right about the part of using XDAI or gnosis chain, it is currently very cheap in commissions. I think you can buy with fiat very easily from Ramp Network, also this Dai on zync is another option. It is not something decentralized, but it gives you a faster experience than a traditional centralized exchange.
